message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SY, cs.CR

This paper discusses the design of a MAC protocol for enabling simultaneous transmit and receive (STR) mode in IEEE 802.11 wireless local area networks (WLANs). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). 

The paper also discusses the challenges of integrating STR mode with minimal protocol modifications, which involves considerations of co-existence of full-duplex (FD) and legacy half-duplex (HD) stations (STAs) and backwards compatibility. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the cs.IT (Information Theory) sub-category, which deals with the study of communication systems and their theoretical foundations. 

Furthermore, the paper evaluates the performance of the proposed solution, which involves aspects of multimedia (cs.MM) and systems and control (cs.SY) sub-categories. 

Finally, the paper discusses the mitigation of contention unfairness, which is a security issue that falls under the cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) sub-category. 

Therefore, the likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper, ordered from most to least likely, are cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SY, and cs.CR.
